chapterDescription: Compound growth, doubling time, capacity planning, scaling projections

problems.question: Your database is 100 GB today. Growth is 10% per month. Size in 12 months?
Traffic doubles every 6 months. Current: 10,000 QPS. Traffic in 2 years?
problems.explanation: 2 years = 4 doubling periods. 10,000 × 2^4 = 10,000 × 16 = 160,000 QPS.

problems.question: You're growing 5% month-over-month. How long to double?
problems.explanation: Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 5 = 14.4 months to double. (Or solve 1.05^n = 2, n ≈ 14.2)

problems.question: Storage grows 50 GB/day. Current: 2 TB. Days until you hit 10 TB limit?
problems.explanation: Need: 10 TB - 2 TB = 8 TB = 8,000 GB. At 50 GB/day: 8,000 ÷ 50 = 160 days.

problems.question: Users: 1M today, targeting 10M in 2 years. Required monthly growth rate?
problems.explanation: Need 10× in 24 months. 1.1^24 = 9.85 ≈ 10×. So ~10% monthly growth.

problems.question: Your service handles 100K QPS. Provisioned for 150K QPS. At 20% monthly growth, when do you need to scale?
problems.explanation: Need to find when 100K × 1.2^n > 150K. 1.2^2 = 1.44, so 100K × 1.44 = 144K. After ~2 months you're near capacity.

problems.question: Data retention is 90 days. Daily ingest is 10 GB, growing 5% monthly. Steady-state storage in 6 months?
problems.explanation: In 6 months, daily ingest = 10 × 1.05^6 = 13.4 GB. Steady-state = 90 × 13.4 = 1,206 GB ≈ 1.2 TB.

problems.question: Peak traffic is 3× average. Average grows from 10K to 30K QPS over a year. Peak capacity needed at year end?
problems.explanation: Year-end average: 30K QPS. Peak = 3 × 30K = 90K QPS capacity needed.

problems.question: You add 100K users/month. Each user stores 10 MB. Monthly storage growth?
problems.explanation: 100K users × 10 MB = 1,000,000 MB = 1 TB per month.

problems.question: Revenue per user is $10/month. Users grow 50% yearly. Current: 100K users. Year 3 monthly revenue?
Your CDN bill is $10K/month. Traffic grows 100% yearly. Year 3 monthly CDN cost?
problems.explanation: Traffic doubles yearly for 3 years: 2^3 = 8×. Cost: $10K × 8 = $80K/month.

problems.question: Database IOPS: 5,000 today. Growing 15% quarterly. IOPS needed in 2 years?
Video uploads: 1,000 hours/day. Each hour = 2 GB. Growth: 10%/month. Daily storage in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year-end uploads: 1,000 × 1.1^12 = 3,140 hours/day. Storage: 3,140 × 2 GB = 6.28 TB/day.

problems.question: Server count: 10 today. Traffic doubles every 8 months. Servers needed in 2 years?
problems.explanation: 2 years = 24 months = 3 doubling periods. 10 × 2^3 = 10 × 8 = 80 servers.

problems.question: Current: 500K DAU. Goal: 5M DAU in 18 months. Required weekly growth rate?
problems.explanation: Need 10× in 78 weeks. 1.03^78 = 10.1 ≈ 10×. So ~3% weekly growth.

problems.question: Black Friday traffic is 10× normal. Normal traffic grows 50%/year. If normal is 10K QPS today, Black Friday QPS in 2 years?
problems.explanation: Normal in 2 years: 10K × 1.5^2 = 22.5K QPS. Black Friday: 22.5K × 10 = 225K QPS.

problems.question: API calls per user: 50/day. Users: 1M, growing 20%/year. Year 2 daily API calls?
problems.explanation: Year 2 users: 1M × 1.2^2 = 1.44M. Daily calls: 1.44M × 50 = 72M.

problems.question: Cache size: 50 GB. Cache grows with data at 8%/month. When does it exceed 100 GB?
problems.explanation: Need 2× growth. Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 8 = 9 months to double.

problems.question: Mobile app: 10K downloads/day, declining 5%/week. Downloads after 4 weeks?
Two regions: US (1M users, 10% growth) and EU (500K users, 20% growth). When does EU exceed US?
Provisioned 1 PB storage. Using 200 TB, growing 30 TB/month. Months until 80% full?
problems.explanation: 80% of 1 PB = 800 TB. Need: 800 - 200 = 600 TB. At 30 TB/month: 600 ÷ 30 = 20 months. Closest is ~18 months.

problems.question: Message queue: 10K msg/sec. Grows 5%/week. Processing capacity: 20K msg/sec. Weeks until saturated?
problems.explanation: Need 2× capacity. Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 5 = 14.4 weeks to double (reach 20K).

problems.question: Index size is 10% of data. Data: 1 TB, growing 50 GB/month. Index size in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Data in 6 months: 1 TB + (6 × 50 GB) = 1.3 TB. Index: 10% × 1.3 TB = 130 GB.

problems.question: Feature adoption: 5% of users today. Growing 50% month-over-month. When does it hit 50% adoption?
Each server handles 1,000 QPS. Traffic: 5,000 QPS, doubling yearly. Minimum servers in 3 years (no headroom)?
problems.explanation: Traffic in 3 years: 5,000 × 2^3 = 40,000 QPS. Servers: 40,000 ÷ 1,000 = 40.

problems.question: Churn rate: 5%/month. New signups: 10K/month (constant). Steady-state user count?
problems.explanation: Steady-state: new signups = churn. If churn is 5% of total, then 10K = 0.05 × total. Total = 200K users.

problems.question: Data lake: 10 TB. Ingest 100 GB/day. Retention: 365 days. Steady-state size?
problems.explanation: Steady-state with 365-day retention: 100 GB × 365 = 36.5 TB. (Initial 10 TB eventually ages out.)

problems.question: Requests/user: 100/day. Users: 500K, 10% monthly growth. When do you exceed 100M requests/day?
problems.explanation: Current: 500K × 100 = 50M req/day. Need 2× (100M). Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 10 = 7.2 months.

problems.question: Infra cost per user: $0.10/month. Users: 1M, growing 30%/year. Year 3 monthly infra cost?
Latency SLO: P99 < 200ms. Current P99: 150ms, degrading 5ms/month due to data growth. Months until SLO breach?
problems.explanation: Need: 200 - 150 = 50ms headroom. At 5ms/month: 50 ÷ 5 = 10 months.

problems.question: Global expansion: add 1 region every 6 months. Each region needs 10 servers. Starting with 3 regions. Servers in 2 years?
problems.explanation: 2 years = 4 new regions. Total: 3 + 4 = 7 regions. Servers: 7 × 10 = 70.

problems.question: Write throughput: 10K/sec. Reads: 100K/sec (10:1 ratio maintained). Writes grow 20%/year. Year 2 read throughput?
problems.explanation: Year 2 writes: 10K × 1.2^2 = 14.4K/sec. Reads (10:1): 144K/sec.

problems.question: Object storage: $0.02/GB/month. 100 TB today, growing 20%/month. Month 6 storage cost?
Event stream: 1M events/day, growing 50%/quarter. Events/day in 1 year?
problems.explanation: 1 year = 4 quarters. 1M × 1.5^4 = 1M × 5.06 = 5.06M events/day.

problems.question: Team grows from 10 to 50 engineers in 2 years. Services typically grow 2× faster than team. Current: 20 services. Services in 2 years?
problems.explanation: Team grows 5× (10→50). Services grow 2× faster = 10×. Services: 20 × 10 = 200.

problems.question: Log volume: 1 GB/hour. Grows 10%/month. Log retention: 30 days. Storage in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 rate: 1 GB/hr × 1.1^6 = 1.77 GB/hr. Daily: 1.77 × 24 = 42.5 GB. 30-day retention: 42.5 × 30 = 1,275 GB ≈ 1.3 TB.

problems.question: Mobile app: 100 MB, updates adding 10 MB/month. App store limit: 200 MB. Months until limit?
problems.explanation: Need: 200 - 100 = 100 MB headroom. At 10 MB/month: 100 ÷ 10 = 10 months.

problems.question: Sharded database: 8 shards, each 80% full. Data grows 5%/month. When do you need to reshard?
problems.explanation: Need data to grow from 80% to 100% = 25% growth. 1.05^n = 1.25. n = ln(1.25)/ln(1.05) = 4.6 months.

problems.question: Customer support tickets: 1,000/day. Growing 15% monthly. Each agent handles 50 tickets/day. Agents needed in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 tickets: 1,000 × 1.15^6 = 2,313/day. Agents: 2,313 ÷ 50 = 46.3 ≈ 46 agents.

problems.question: Photo storage per user: 500 MB average, growing 20%/year. User count stable at 1M. Year 3 total storage?
problems.explanation: Year 3 per-user: 500 MB × 1.2^3 = 864 MB. Total: 1M × 864 MB = 864 TB.

problems.question: CI/CD pipeline: 100 builds/day. Grows 25%/quarter. Build time: 10 minutes. Compute hours/day in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year = 4 quarters. Builds: 100 × 1.25^4 = 244/day. Compute: 244 × 10 min = 2,440 min = 40.7 hours ≈ 42 hours.

problems.question: ML model training: 1 hour today. Data grows 50%/month. Training time scales linearly. Month 4 training time?
problems.explanation: Training time: 1 hr × 1.5^4 = 5.06 hours.

problems.question: Kubernetes pods: 50 today. Traffic grows 30%/month. Pods scale linearly with traffic. Pods in 3 months?
Network egress: 10 TB/month at $0.05/GB. Traffic grows 100%/year. Year 2 monthly egress cost?
Redis memory: 16 GB, 70% utilized. Keys grow 10%/month. When do you need to upgrade?
problems.explanation: Current: 70% of 16 GB = 11.2 GB. Max: 16 GB. Need ~43% growth (11.2 → 16). 1.1^n = 1.43. n = 3.6 months.

problems.question: Ad impressions: 100M/day. Revenue: $1 per 1,000 impressions. Impressions grow 10%/month. Daily revenue in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 impressions: 100M × 1.1^6 = 177M. Revenue: 177M ÷ 1,000 × $1 = $177K.

problems.question: Startup: 10K users, tripling every 6 months. Series A requires 1M users. Time to reach?
problems.explanation: Need 100× (10K → 1M). 3^n = 100. n = log₃(100) = 4.2 periods × 6 months = 25 months ≈ 24 months.

problems.question: Compliance: must retain 7 years of data. Current ingest: 1 TB/year, growing 20%/year. Year 7 total storage?
problems.explanation: Geometric sum: Year 1 = 1 TB, Year 2 = 1.2 TB, ..., Year 7 = 2.99 TB. Sum = 1 × (1.2^7 - 1)/(1.2 - 1) = 12.9 TB ≈ 12 TB.

problems.question: API rate limit: 1,000 req/min per user. 10K users, each using 50% of limit. Total API capacity needed?
problems.explanation: Per user: 50% × 1,000 = 500 req/min. Total: 10K × 500 = 5M req/min.

problems.question: Time-series DB: 1M metrics, 15-second resolution, 30-day retention. Metrics grow 20%/month. Month 3 data points?
problems.explanation: Month 3 metrics: 1M × 1.2^3 = 1.73M. Points per metric: 30 days × 86,400 sec ÷ 15 sec = 172,800. Total: 1.73M × 172,800 = 299B ≈ 250B points.

problems.question: Read replicas handle 80% of reads. Total reads: 100K QPS, growing 25%/quarter. Replica capacity: 50K QPS each. Replicas needed in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year-end reads: 100K × 1.25^4 = 244K QPS. Replica reads (80%): 195K QPS. Replicas: 195K ÷ 50K = 3.9 ≈ 4. With headroom: 6 replicas.

problems.question: Elasticsearch cluster: 3 nodes, 500 GB each. Index grows 10 GB/day. When do you need a 4th node (at 80% capacity)?
problems.explanation: Total capacity: 1.5 TB. 80% = 1.2 TB usable. Starting at 0: 1,200 GB ÷ 10 GB/day = 120 days. At 80% capacity before needing 4th.

problems.question: Disk IOPS: 10K today, growing 8%/month. SSD max: 20K IOPS. Months until you need to upgrade?
problems.explanation: Need 2× (10K → 20K). Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 8 = 9 months to double.

problems.question: B2B SaaS: 100 enterprise customers, each generating 1 TB/year of logs. Customer growth: 50%/year. Year 3 annual log volume?
problems.explanation: Year 3 customers: 100 × 1.5^3 = 337.5. Log volume: 337.5 × 1 TB = 337.5 TB ≈ 338 TB.

problems.question: Feature flags evaluated 1M times/day. Each new feature adds 100K evaluations/day. Launching 2 features/month. Month 6 daily evaluations?
problems.explanation: New evaluations: 12 features × 100K = 1.2M. Total: 1M + 1.2M = 2.2M/day.

problems.question: Kafka partitions: 10 per topic, 50 topics. Adding 5 topics/month. Year-end partition count?
problems.explanation: Year-end topics: 50 + (12 × 5) = 110. Partitions: 110 × 10 = 1,100.

problems.question: Container registry: 500 images, 200 MB average. New images: 20/week. Image size grows 5%/month. Month 6 storage?
API Gateway: 10K routes today. New routes: 100/month. Each route adds 1 KB to config. Config size limit: 16 MB. Months until limit?
problems.explanation: Current config: 10K × 1 KB = 10 MB. Limit: 16 MB. Headroom: 6 MB = 6,000 KB = 6,000 routes. At 100/month: 60 months.

problems.question: Microservices: 20 today, adding 2/month. Each service needs 2 GB RAM. Total RAM in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year-end services: 20 + (12 × 2) = 44. RAM: 44 × 2 GB = 88 GB.

problems.question: GraphQL schema: 100 types. Adding 5 types/month. Each type averages 10 fields. Fields in 6 months?
Security scans: 1 hour/repo. 50 repos, adding 3/month. Daily scan time in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 repos: 50 + (6 × 3) = 68. Scan time: 68 hours/day.

problems.question: Webhook retries: 1% failure rate, 3 retries max. 1M webhooks/day, growing 20%/month. Extra retries/day in 3 months?
problems.explanation: Month 3 webhooks: 1M × 1.2^3 = 1.73M. Failures: 1% = 17.3K. With retries (worst case 3×): 51.9K ≈ 52K extra requests.

problems.question: CDN cache: 10 TB, 90% hit rate. Traffic doubles yearly. Origin bandwidth today: 100 GB/day. Year 2 origin bandwidth?
problems.explanation: Traffic 4× (doubles twice). Origin traffic (10% of total): 100 GB × 4 = 400 GB/day.

problems.question: Database backup: 2 hours today for 500 GB. Data grows 10%/month. Backup time in 6 months (linear scaling)?
problems.explanation: Month 6 data: 500 × 1.1^6 = 886 GB. Backup time: 2 × (886/500) = 3.54 hours ≈ 3.5 hours.

problems.question: Prometheus retention: 15 days. Metrics: 500K series, 15-second scrape. Series grow 10%/month. Month 6 storage (2 bytes/sample)?
problems.explanation: Month 6 series: 500K × 1.1^6 = 886K. Samples/series: 15 days × 86400 ÷ 15 = 86,400. Total: 886K × 86,400 × 2 bytes = 153 GB ≈ 140 GB.

problems.question: Message bus: 100K msg/sec capacity. Usage: 60K msg/sec, growing 5%/week. Weeks until 90% capacity?
problems.explanation: 90% capacity = 90K msg/sec. Need 60K → 90K = 50% growth. 1.05^n = 1.5. n = ln(1.5)/ln(1.05) = 8.3 weeks.

problems.question: Database: 1 billion rows, growing 10M rows/day. Query time scales O(log n). Current query: 100ms. Query time in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year-end rows: 1B + (365 × 10M) = 4.65B. Log ratio: log(4.65B)/log(1B) = 9.67/9 = 1.07. Query time: 100 × 1.07 = 107ms ≈ 110ms.

problems.question: S3 requests: 100M/month at $0.0004/1000 requests. Growing 30%/month. Month 4 request cost?
Video transcoding queue: 1,000 jobs/day. Processing: 800 jobs/day. Jobs grow 5%/week. When does backlog exceed 10,000?
problems.explanation: Daily backlog: (1000 × 1.05^n) - 800. Cumulative backlog hits 10K when... This is complex. Simplified: when inflow = 800 × 1.25 = 1000, that's week 0. Backlog grows. At ~10 weeks, cumulative deficit ≈ 10K.

problems.question: Search index: 10M documents. Adding 100K docs/day. Index rebuild: 1 hour today (linear scaling). Rebuild time in 30 days?
problems.explanation: Day 30 docs: 10M + (30 × 100K) = 13M. With linear scaling: 1 hr × (13M/10M) = 1.3 hours.

problems.question: Cloud spend: $100K/month. Engineering: 20% on optimization saves 10% monthly. Net spend in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Each month: 10% reduction. After 6 months: $100K × 0.9^6 = $53.1K/month.

problems.question: Error rate: 0.1% of requests. 1M requests/day, growing 15%/month. Daily errors in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 requests: 1M × 1.15^6 = 2.31M. Errors: 0.1% = 2,310 ≈ 2,300/day.

problems.question: Load balancer: 100K connections capacity. Current: 40K, growing 10%/week. Weeks until 80% capacity?
Notification volume: 10M/day. Users enable notifications at 60%, growing 5% per month (additive). Volume in 6 months if user base is stable?
problems.explanation: Month 6 opt-in: 60% + (6 × 5%) = 90%. Volume scales: 10M × (90/60) = 15M/day.

problems.question: SSD wear: 1 drive write per day (DWPD) rating. Writing 500 GB/day to 1 TB drive. Growth: 10%/month. Months until exceeding DWPD?
problems.explanation: DWPD limit: 1 TB/day. Current: 500 GB. Need 2× growth. Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 10 = 7.2 months.

problems.question: API versioning: v1 has 80% traffic, v2 has 20%. v1 declining 10%/month, v2 growing 20%/month. When does v2 exceed v1?
Embedding dimensions: 768 floats (4 bytes each). Vectors: 10M, growing 1M/month. Storage in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 vectors: 10M + 6M = 16M. Size: 16M × 768 × 4 = 49.2 GB.

problems.question: CI builds: 50/day taking 10 min each. Builds grow 20%/month, time grows 5%/month. Month 3 daily build time?
problems.explanation: Month 3 builds: 50 × 1.2^3 = 86. Time each: 10 × 1.05^3 = 11.6 min. Total: 86 × 11.6 = 998 min ≈ 17 hours.

problems.question: User sessions: 100K concurrent. Session duration: 10 min. DAU grows 25%/quarter. Year-end peak concurrent sessions?
problems.explanation: Year = 4 quarters. Sessions scale with DAU: 100K × 1.25^4 = 244K concurrent.

problems.question: Incident rate: 10/month. Each incident costs 4 engineering hours. Team grows 50%/year. Engineering hours lost to incidents in year 2?
problems.explanation: Incident rate may scale with system complexity (more engineers = more services = more incidents) or stay flat. Can't determine without knowing how incidents scale with team size.

problems.question: DNS queries: 1M/day. 20% growth/month. DNS provider charges $0.40/million queries. Monthly cost in 6 months?
Deployment frequency: once/week. Goal: daily deployments in 6 months. Required improvement rate?
problems.explanation: Need 7× improvement (weekly → daily) in 6 months. 1.4^6 = 7.5 ≈ 7×. Need ~40%/month improvement rate.

problems.question: Code review queue: 20 PRs/day created. Review capacity: 15/day. Backlog grows linearly. Days until 100 PR backlog?
problems.explanation: Daily backlog growth: 20 - 15 = 5 PRs. Days to 100: 100 ÷ 5 = 20 days.

problems.question: Serverless function: 1M invocations/month at $0.20/million. Invocations double monthly. Month 4 cost?
problems.explanation: Month 4 invocations: 1M × 2^4 = 16M. Cost: 16 × $0.20 = $3.20.

problems.question: Data pipeline latency: 5 minutes today. Data volume grows 20%/month. Latency scales O(n). Month 6 latency?
problems.explanation: Month 6 volume: 1.2^6 = 2.99×. Latency: 5 × 2.99 = 14.95 min ≈ 15 minutes.

problems.question: ML inference: 100 req/sec on 1 GPU. Requests grow 40%/month. GPUs needed in 3 months (80% target utilization)?
problems.explanation: Month 3 requests: 100 × 1.4^3 = 274 req/sec. At 80 req/sec per GPU (80% of 100): 274 ÷ 80 = 3.4 ≈ 4 GPUs.

problems.question: Compliance audit: 1 week for 100 services. Adding 5 services/month. Audit duration in 1 year?
problems.explanation: Year-end services: 100 + 60 = 160. Audit time: 1 week × (160/100) = 1.6 weeks.

problems.question: Database vacuum: runs 2 hours/week. Data grows 15%/month. Vacuum time in 6 months (scales O(n))?
problems.explanation: Month 6 data: 1.15^6 = 2.31×. Vacuum time: 2 × 2.31 = 4.62 hours.

problems.question: Support tickets: 500/week. Growth: 10%/month. Resolution time goal: 24 hours. Agents needed (each handles 20 tickets/day) in 6 months?
problems.explanation: Month 6 tickets: 500 × 1.1^6 = 886/week = 127/day. Agents: 127 ÷ 20 = 6.4. With buffer: ~7-10 agents.

problems.question: Network bandwidth: 10 Gbps capacity. Usage: 4 Gbps, growing 8%/month. Months until 80% capacity?
problems.explanation: 80% = 8 Gbps. Need 4 → 8 = 2×. Rule of 72: 72 ÷ 8 = 9 months.

problems.question: Container restarts: 100/day due to OOM. Memory usage grows 5%/month. Increasing container memory by 50% reduces restarts to near-zero. Months until OOM returns?
problems.explanation: 50% memory headroom. Need 1.5× growth to exhaust. 1.05^n = 1.5. n = ln(1.5)/ln(1.05) = 8.3 months.

problems.question: Revenue: $1M ARR. Growing 15%/month. When do you hit $10M ARR?
Technical debt paydown: dedicating 20% of sprints. Debt accumulates at 10% of velocity. Net debt change?
problems.explanation: Adding 10%, paying 20%. Net: -10% per sprint. Debt decreases.
